string-array.name: changelog_detail
string-array.item:
-Added Verse of the Day card 
 -Updated interface 
 -Added a Settings and About page in the menu 
 -Improved support for older devices 
 -General code optimization
-Fixed error in parsing HTML for Verse of the Day card
-Added ability to set verses as memorized and display them in a separate list. Memorized verses will not be displayed in a notification \n -Added ability to edit verses \n -Various bugfixes

-Added backup and restore feature. Data can be backed up to external storage which persists through uninstall and reinstall \n -Fixed bug which sometimes caused crash when updating from V1.1.01 to 1.2. Thanks to everyone who reported it!

-Complete UI redesign. Changed app icon, added navigation drawer, and moved many buttons to the actionbar. In general, cleaned up interface and created a consistent theme \n -Dramatically improved support on older Android versions. Now pre-ICS devices look nice and modern! -Added ability to share verses to and from the app

-Added daily Verse of the Day notifications \n -Improved UI: added transition animations and made everything reflect changes immediately \n -Significant internal code revision, improved overall stability
-Fixed issue with setting alarm for notification \n -Fixed issue where Notification Time preference didn\'t look like other preferences
-Added display options to encourage better memorization! Notifications can not show the verse as dashes, the first letter of each word, or both.
-Verse of the Day now available in multiple Bible translations\n -Added homescreen and lockscreen widgets\n

-Massive internal code revision and bug fixes -Input Card now supports searching the internet for the verse given in the "Reference" field\n -Verse list can now be sorted alphabetically, according to date the verses were added, and their order in the Bible. "Next verse" from notification and widget follow the chosen sort order\n

string-array.name: init_verses
string-array.item: This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night, so that you may be careful to do according to all that is written in it. For then you will make your way prosperous, and then you will have good success.
But in your hearts honor Christ the Lord as holy, always being prepared to make a defense to anyone who asks you for a reason for the hope that is in you.
For all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God, and are justified by his grace as a gift, through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus.
But God shows his love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God, not a result of works, so that no one may boast.
All Scripture is breathed out by God and profitable for teaching, for reproof, for correction, and for training in righteousness, that the man of God may be complete, equipped for every good work.

And by this we know that we have come to know him, if we keep his commandments. Whoever says \"I know him\" but does not keep his commandments is a liar, and the truth is not in him, but whoever keeps his word, in him truly the love of God is perfected. By this we may know that we are in him: whoever says he abides in him ought to walk in the same way in which he walked.

Are you looking for a new way to memorize Scripture? You should try this new app called Scripture Memory Notifications! You can add your favorite verses or try to memorize the Verse of the Day. You can even challenge yourself with just the first letter of each word, and much more, all from your phone\'s notification drawer!\n\nLearn more at https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.caseybrooks.scripturememory
